metadata.Title: CVE-2022-31747 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers Andrew McCreight, Nicolas B. Pierron, and the MozillaFuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 100 and FirefoxESR 91.9. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and wepresume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited torun arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.10, Firefox< 101, and Firefox ESR < 91.10.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-31747` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
